intro: Hieracium theodori, commonly known as Theodore's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring moist and sunny conditions. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium theodori is often found in temperate regions and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich soils.
